custom_item_1.description: 1.1 Secure Login and Telnet Disabling - Enable SSH server
custom_item_1.info: From the perspective of security, the management plane should support at least the SSH/SSL login mode. Ordinary plain text Telnet/ftp login is vulnerable to attack, and such secure login modes as SSH and SFTP should be supported. The session validity period must be limited.
custom_item_1.solution:
It is recommended to enable ssh server

    Enable SSH server by running:
    ZXR10 (config)#ssh server enable

custom_item_2.description: 1.1 Secure Login and Telnet Disabling - Disable telnet server
custom_item_2.info: From the perspective of security, the management plane should support at least the SSH/SSL login mode. Ordinary plain text Telnet/ftp login is vulnerable to attack, and such secure login modes as SSH and SFTP should be supported. The session validity period must be limited.
custom_item_2.solution:
It is recommended to disable telnet server.

    Disable telnet server by running:
    ZXR10 (config)#line telnet server disable

custom_item_3.description: 1.2 Password Security Policy - a) The default password length shouldn't be below 8 characters
custom_item_3.info:
Strong passwords are supported to prevent passwords from being cracked. When a password is set, password complexity is detected by default. If a password does not meet the policy, a warning is required. A strong password mode should be provided. The password verification mechanism is as follows:

     a) The default password length shouldn't be below 8 characters.
     b) The password must include either three of 'number', 'capital', 'lowercase', 'special-character' or set the 'character-set-num' value to 3-4
     c) Configure 'strong-password dictionary' and 'same-consecutive' to avoid weak password
     d) Check either of the following words exist in configuration file:
        - Encrypt none
        - Authentication null
        - Encrypted null
        - Encryption null
        - Security-protocol noauth
        - Encrypted noauth
     e) If 'strong-password max-length' not displayed in configuration, then pass this check.
        If 'strong-password max-length' displayed in configuration, but max-length value below 10, or not both configuration 'username-related-chk inverse' and 'strong-password date-check enable' commands, then fail this check.
     f) The validity period of an account can be configured.
custom_item_3.solution:
It is recommended to set password length to at least 8 characters

     ZXR10# configure terminal
     ZXR10 (config)# system-user
     ZXR10 (config-system-user)# strong-password length 8

custom_item_4.description: 1.2 Password Security Policy - b) The password must include either three of 'number', 'capital', 'lowercase', 'special-character' or set the 'character-set-num' value to 3-4
custom_item_4.info:
Strong passwords are supported to prevent passwords from being cracked. When a password is set, password complexity is detected by default. If a password does not meet the policy, a warning is required. A strong password mode should be provided. The password verification mechanism is as follows:

     a) The default password length shouldn't be below 8 characters.
     b) The password must include either three of 'number', 'capital', 'lowercase', 'special-character' or set the 'character-set-num' value to 3-4
     c) Configure 'strong-password dictionary' and 'same-consecutive' to avoid weak password
     d) Check either of the following words exist in configuration file:
        - Encrypt none
        - Authentication null
        - Encrypted null
        - Encryption null
        - Security-protocol noauth
        - Encrypted noauth
     e) If 'strong-password max-length' not displayed in configuration, then pass this check.
        If 'strong-password max-length' displayed in configuration, but max-length value below 10, or not both configuration 'username-related-chk inverse' and 'strong-password date-check enable' commands, then fail this check.
     f) The validity period of an account can be configured.
custom_item_4.solution:
It is recommended to set password consists of digits, letters, and symbols

     ZXR10# configure terminal
     ZXR10 (config)# system-user
     ZXR10 (config-system-user)# strong-password length 8 character number capital lowercase special-character
custom_item_4.item: (.*strong-password length .+ character number capital lowercase special-character|.*strong-password length .+ character number capital lowercase|.*strong-password length .+ character number capital special-character|.*strong-password length .+ character number lowercase special-character|.*strong-password length .+ character capital lowercase special-character)|(.*strong-password length .+ character-set-num [3-4])

custom_item_5.description: 1.2 Password Security Policy - c) Configure 'strong-password dictionary' and 'same-consecutive' to avoid weak password - strong-password dictionary
custom_item_5.info:
Strong passwords are supported to prevent passwords from being cracked. When a password is set, password complexity is detected by default. If a password does not meet the policy, a warning is required. A strong password mode should be provided. The password verification mechanism is as follows:

     a) The default password length shouldn't be below 8 characters.
     b) The password must include either three of 'number', 'capital', 'lowercase', 'special-character' or set the 'character-set-num' value to 3-4
     c) Configure 'strong-password dictionary' and 'same-consecutive' to avoid weak password
     d) Check either of the following words exist in configuration file:
        - Encrypt none

        - Encrypted null

        - Encrypted noauth

custom_item_7.description: 1.2 Password Security Policy - d) Check either of the following words exist in configuration file
custom_item_7.info:
Strong passwords are supported to prevent passwords from being cracked. When a password is set, password complexity is detected by default. If a password does not meet the policy, a warning is required. A strong password mode should be provided. The password verification mechanism is as follows:

     a) The default password length shouldn't be below 8 characters.
     b) The password must include either three of 'number', 'capital', 'lowercase', 'special-character' or set the 'character-set-num' value to 3-4
     c) Configure 'strong-password dictionary' and 'same-consecutive' to avoid weak password
     d) Check either of the following words exist in configuration file:

custom_item_7.solution:
It is recommended config to support stores passwords in ciphertext, do not include the following phrases in the configuration:

     - encrypt none
     - authentication null
     - encrypted null
     - encryption null
     - security-protocol noauth
     - encrypted noauth

custom_item_11.info:
Strong passwords are supported to prevent passwords from being cracked. When a password is set, password complexity is detected by default. If a password does not meet the policy, a warning is required. A strong password mode should be provided. The password verification mechanism is as follows:

         a) The default password length shouldn't be below 8 characters.

            - Encrypt none
            - Authentication null
            - Encrypted null
            - Encryption null
            - Security-protocol noauth
            - Encrypted noauth

custom_item_11.solution:
It is recommended to set the password to irrelevant to the username and date.

         ZXR10# configure terminal
         ZXR10 (config)# system-user

custom_item_13.description: 1.2 Password Security Policy - e) Check for strong-password max-length
custom_item_13.info:
Strong passwords are supported to prevent passwords from being cracked. When a password is set, password complexity is detected by default. If a password does not meet the policy, a warning is required. A strong password mode should be provided. The password verification mechanism is as follows:

        a) The default password length shouldn't be below 8 characters.
        b) The password must include either three of 'number', 'capital', 'lowercase', 'special-character' or set the 'character-set-num' value to 3-4
        c) Configure 'strong-password dictionary' and 'same-consecutive' to avoid weak password
        d) Check either of the following words exist in configuration file:
           - Encrypt none
           - Authentication null
           - Encrypted null
           - Encryption null
           - Security-protocol noauth
           - Encrypted noauth
        e) If 'strong-password max-length' not displayed in configuration, then pass this check.
           If 'strong-password max-length' displayed in configuration, but max-length value below 10, or not both configuration 'username-related-chk inverse' and 'strong-password date-check enable' commands, then fail this check.
        f) The validity period of an account can be configured.
custom_item_13.solution:
It is recommended to set the maximum password length to at least 10

       ZXR10# configure terminal
       ZXR10 (config)# system-user
       ZXR10 (config-system-user)# strong-password max-length 64

custom_item_14.info:
Strong passwords are supported to prevent passwords from being cracked. When a password is set, password complexity is detected by default. If a password does not meet the policy, a warning is required. A strong password mode should be provided. The password verification mechanism is as follows:

     a) The default password length shouldn't be below 8 characters.
     b) The password must include either three of 'number', 'capital', 'lowercase', 'special-character' or set the 'character-set-num' value to 3-4
     c) Configure 'strong-password dictionary' and 'same-consecutive' to avoid weak password

     f) The validity period of an account can be configured.
custom_item_14.solution:
It is recommended to set the password validity period

     ZXR10# configure terminal
     ZXR10 (config)# system-user
     ZXR10 (config-system-user)# user-name xxx
     ZXR10 (config-system-user-username)# password-duration 360

custom_item_17.info: Some tools exist on the Internet, which specifically attack the management-plane protocol accounts of the system and frequently attempt accounts to attack devices so as to obtain accounts. Therefore, the system should be able to reject all remote login requests in a blocking manner when it is found that repeated remote login attempts fail for a certain number of consecutive times by monitoring the system account authentication. At this time, only IP requests from whitelisted users are allowed to be responded). This blocking can last for a period of time, so as to achieve the purpose of timely cutting off brute-force cracking attempts and protecting the CPU processing capability of the management plane.
custom_item_17.solution:
Configuring the number of failures and locking time by running the following commands:

          ZXR10 (config)#system-user
          ZXR10 (config-system-user)#user-authen-restriction fail-time 3 lock-minute 2

custom_item_18.description: Check if SNMP server v1 has been enabled

custom_item_19.description: Check if SNMP server v2c has been enabled

custom_item_20.description: Check if SNMP server v1 has been enabled

custom_item_21.description: Check if SNMP server v2c has been enabled

custom_item_22.description: Check if SNMP server v3 has been enabled

custom_item_23.description: 1.4 SNMP Security - a) SNMP Community Security
custom_item_23.info: Modify the default Community password of SNMP to prevent hackers from using the same Community to obtain sensitive device information and attack ROSNG series products.
custom_item_23.solution:
Configuring VIEW-based read/write access capability

        ZXR10#config terminal

        Enter configuration commands, one per line. End with CNTL/Z.
        ZXR10 (config)# snmp-server community my_readonly view AllView ro
        ZXR10 (config)# snmp-server community my_readwrite view AllView rw

custom_item_24.info: Specify SNMP server, restrict the management address, prevent untrusted networks from connecting to snmp, and reduce the possibility of ROSNG products being attacked.
custom_item_24.solution:
Configure the snmp Server:

        ZXR10#config terminal

        Enter configuration commands, one per line. End with CNTL/Z.
        ZXR10 (config)## ipv4-access-list snmp_acl
        ZXR10 (config-ipv4-acl)#rule 1 permit 14.2.6.60 0.0.0.0
        ZXR10 (config-ipv4-acl)#exit
        ZXR10 (config)# snmp-server access-list ipv4 snmp_acl

custom_item_25.description: 1.4 SNMP Security - c) SNMP Security Protection Function
custom_item_25.info: Enable the SNMP security function to restrict the number of times of management address, prevent hackers from malicious attacks, and improve the security of ROSNG series products.
custom_item_25.solution:
Enable security protection:
        ZXR10 (config)#snmp-server security block 200  15 100 when 10 60

custom_item_26.description: Check for if ftp-server is enabled

custom_item_27.description: Check for if sftp-server is enabled

custom_item_28.description: Check if SSH server is enabled

custom_item_29.description: Check if sftp top-directory has been configured

custom_item_30.info: Set ftp upload and download file permission control to facilitate the separate control of different users and different permissions, and strengthen the security of ROSNG series products.
custom_item_30.solution:
Under authorization-template, configure the corresponding ftp permissions, such as:

        ZXR10 (config-system-user-author-temp) #sftp top-directory /datadisk0/ read-only

custom_item_31.info: Set ftp upload and download file permission control to facilitate the separate control of different users and different permissions, and strengthen the security of ROSNG series products.
custom_item_31.solution:
Close the ftp access channel, for example:

           ZXR10 (config)# no ftp-server enable
           ZXR10 (config-system-user-author-temp)# login-type-allowed ssh.

custom_item_33.description: Check if web secure-server ssl-context is configured

custom_item_34.description: 1.6 Support Web Access Security - a) ciphersuite
custom_item_34.info: Provide secure HTTPS webpage access between the local device and users, and a secure transmission channel for users' Web management devices. Avoid interception of intermediate data. If the login page needs to be displayed in the WEB, the login username and password can be used to access the page, meeting the scanning requirements of security tools such as nessus, webinspect, and AWE.
custom_item_34.solution:
1. use HTTPS instead of HTTP, SSL must bound PKI profile, the bounded PKI profile needs to import a legal and valid CA certificate
       2. TLS(SSL) version is recommended to be greater than TLS v1.2, at least not less than TLS v1.1.
       3. TLS algorithm does not contain insecure algorithms, which include: CBC, SHA1, MD5

custom_item_40.info:
Generate logs for auditable events and record at least the following information in each audit record:
     1) Date and time when the event occurs
     2) Event type
     3) Administrator identity
     4) Event Result (succeed or fail)
custom_item_40.solution:
Configure the log type and permission of the user authorization template:

     ZXR10(config-system-user)#authorization-template 1
        ZXR10(config-system-user-author-temp)#logfile-allowed cmd-log read-only

custom_item_41.description: 1.8 SSH Strong Algorithm - a) Disable encryption none
custom_item_41.info: Disable the weak algorithm of the ssh to interact with the client through the strong algorithm in the ssh connection, and provide security protection for the ROSNG series products.
custom_item_41.solution:
Disable the ssh weak algorithm:

     ZXR10 (config)#ssh server encryption none disable

custom_item_55.info: There is a security risk to the ssl lower versions of the equipment. The device can be configured to support higher versions and algorithms only to reduce the connection risk of the ROSNG series products.
custom_item_55.solution:
1. SSL must bound PKI profile, the bounded PKI profile needs to import a legal and valid CA certificate
         2. TLS(SSL) version is recommended to be greater than TLS v1.2, at least not less than TLS v1.1.
         3. TLS algorithm does not contain insecure algorithms, which include: CBC, SHA1, MD5
         4. Disable renegotiate

custom_item_59.description: 2.1 Protection Policy for the CPS Control Engine
custom_item_59.info:
Generate logs for auditable events and record at least the following information in each audit record:
     1) Date and time when the event occurs
     2) Event type
     3) Administrator identity
     4) Event Result (succeed or fail)

custom_item_60.description: 2.2 NTP Security Protection - a) Enable NTP
custom_item_60.info:
From the perspective of security, the equipment should support the NTP clock synchronization protocol to ensure that all the equipment in the network have the same clock and that the log timestamps are correct. ROSNG supports the NTP protocol.

        In addition, in order to ensure the security of the NTP protocol, it supports ACL filtering to limit NTP packets that enter the IP network device from the external network, and allows MD5 authentication on NTP sessions.
custom_item_60.solution:
It is recommended to config NTP for clock synchronization.

     ZXR10(config)#ntp enable

custom_item_61.description: 2.2 NTP Security Protection - b) NTP access-group
custom_item_61.info:
From the perspective of security, the equipment should support the NTP clock synchronization protocol to ensure that all the equipment in the network have the same clock and that the log timestamps are correct. ROSNG supports the NTP protocol.

        In addition, in order to ensure the security of the NTP protocol, it supports ACL filtering to limit NTP packets that enter the IP network device from the external network, and allows MD5 authentication on NTP sessions.
custom_item_61.solution:
It is recommended to config NTP for clock synchronization, and also set the ipv4-access-list filtering rules.

     ZXR10#config terminal
     ZXR10 (config)#ntp access-group ipv4-access-list xxx

custom_item_62.description: 2.2 NTP Security Protection - c) NTP Auth-key encrypted
custom_item_62.info:
From the perspective of security, the equipment should support the NTP clock synchronization protocol to ensure that all the equipment in the network have the same clock and that the log timestamps are correct. ROSNG supports the NTP protocol.

        In addition, in order to ensure the security of the NTP protocol, it supports ACL filtering to limit NTP packets that enter the IP network device from the external network, and allows MD5 authentication on NTP sessions.
custom_item_62.solution:
It is recommended to config NTP for clock synchronization, and also set the ipv4-access-list filtering rules and authentication key.

     ZXR10#config terminal
     ZXR10 (config)#ntp authenticate
     ZXR10 (config)#ntp authentication-key 1 md5 clear xxxxxxx
     ZXR10 (config)#ntp trusted-key 1

custom_item_63.description: Check if inter-vlan-proxy has been configured

custom_item_64.description: Check if local-proxy-arp has been configured

custom_item_65.description: Check if proxy has been configured

custom_item_66.description: Check if proxy local has been configured

custom_item_67.description: 2.3 Disable the Proxy ARP Function - a) No proxy
custom_item_67.info:
PROXY ARP should be used in networks where the host is not configured with default gateway or there is no routing policy.

      PROXY ARP has negative effects:
      1. ARP traffic on one network segment is increased
      2. The host needs a larger ARP table to process the mapping from IP address to MAC address
      3. Security problems are available, such as ARP spoofing (spoofing)
      4. Does not work for a network that does not use ARP to parse addresses
      5. Network topology cannot be summarized and promoted
custom_item_67.solution:
Disable the functions related to Proxy ARP:

      ZXR10 (config)#arp
      ZXR10 (config-arp)#interface fei-0/1/1/13
      ZXR10 (config-arp-if)#no proxy
      ZXR10 (config-arp-if)#no inter-vlan-proxy
      ZXR10 (config-arp-if)#no proxy local
      ZXR10 (config-arp-if)#no local-proxy-arp

custom_item_71.info:
The ROSNG system product no longer uses U to respond to the icmp request.

     Use icmp unreachable and change the source address to the address of the attacking device to prevent smurf attack
custom_item_71.solution:
ZXR10#config terminal
     ZXR10 (config)#icmp-config
     ZXR10 (config-icmp)# interface fei-0/2/1/7
     ZXR10 (config-icmp-if)#no ip unreachable
     ZXR10 (config-icmp-if)#no ipv6 unreachable
     ZXR10 (config-icmp-if)#end

custom_item_72.info: Use the banner to modify the system greeting so as to prevent hackers from malicious access to ROSNG system product information.
custom_item_72.solution:
Configure the system greeting:

     ZXR10 (config)#banner incoming C
     Enter TEXT message. End with the character 'C'.
     'Your greeting message'
     C
     ZXR10 (config)#

custom_item_73.description: Check if ospf routing has been configured

custom_item_74.description: 3.1 Authentication and Verification of OSPF Routing Protocols - authentication message-digest
custom_item_74.info: To improve network security, the OSPF routing algorithm should support MD5 encryption authentication
custom_item_74.solution:
Enable MD5 authentication

      ZXR10 (config-ospf-100-area-1)#authentication message-digest
      ZXR10 (config-ospf-100-if-fei-0/1/0/8.1)#authentication message-digest
      ZXR10 (config-ospf-100-if-fei-0/1/0/8.1)#message-digest-key 1 md5 fffff

custom_item_75.description: 3.1 Authentication and Verification of OSPF Routing Protocols - message-digest-key
custom_item_75.info: To improve network security, the OSPF routing algorithm should support MD5 encryption authentication
custom_item_75.solution:
Enable MD5 authentication

      ZXR10 (config-ospf-100-area-1)#authentication message-digest
      ZXR10 (config-ospf-100-if-fei-0/1/0/8.1)#authentication message-digest
      ZXR10 (config-ospf-100-if-fei-0/1/0/8.1)#message-digest-key 1 md5 fffff

custom_item_76.description: Check if ISIS routing has been configured

custom_item_77.description: Check if ISIS routing has been configured

custom_item_78.description: Check if ISIS routing has been configured

custom_item_79.description: 3.2 Authentication and Verification of ISIS Routing Protocols - authentication-type hmac-md5
custom_item_79.info: To improve network security, the ISIS routing algorithm should support HMAC-MD5 encryption authentication
custom_item_79.solution:
Enable HMAC-MD5 authentication.

       ZXR10 (config-isis-100-if-fei-0/1/0/8.1)#authentication-type hmac-md5
       ZXR10 (config-isis-100-if-fei-0/1/0/8.1)#authentication kkk
       ZXR10 (config-isis-100)#authentication-type hmac-md5
       ZXR10 (config-isis-100)#authentication ffff

custom_item_81.description: Check if bgp routing has been configured

custom_item_82.description: 3.3 Authentication and Verification of BGP Routing Protocols
custom_item_82.info: To improve network security, BGP must support MD5 encryption authentication.
custom_item_82.solution:
Enable MD5 authentication.

     R1 (config-bgp-100)#neighbor 100.100.100.2 password xxx
